bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 85 (Monday, May 17, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. COSTA:H.R. 3272.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The constitutional authority under which this bill rests isthe power of Congress to make rules for the government andregulation of the land and naval forces, as enumerated inArticle I, Section 8, Clause 14 of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H2421]

item.title: Biodiesel Tax Credit Extension Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.title: Biodiesel Tax Credit Extension Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Biodiesel, Renewable Diesel, and Alternative Fuels Extension Act of 2021

This bill extends and modifies the tax credits for biodiesel, renewable diesel, and alternative fuels.

The bill extends through 2025 (1) the income tax credit for biodiesel and renewable diesel used as fuel, (2) the excise tax credit for biodiesel mixtures, (3) the excise tax credit for alternative fuels, (4) the excise tax credit for alternative fuel mixtures, and (5) the payments that are equivalent to the excise tax credits for biodiesel mixtures and alternative fuels.

Beginning in 2023, the bill phases down the credits for biodiesel, biodiesel mixtures, alternative fuels, and alternative fuel mixtures by reducing the credits by specified amounts.

bill.title: Biodiesel, Renewable Diesel, and Alternative Fuels Extension Act of 2021

item.title: Biodiesel, Renewable Diesel, and Alternative Fuels Extension Act of 2021
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend biodiesel and renewable diesel incentives, and for other purposes.
Biodiesel, Renewable Diesel, and Alternative Fuels Extension Act of 2021

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
